docs.snippet: SILVERMAN--Arthur. The employees of Senator Investment Group mourn the passing of Arthur Silverman, beloved father of our managing partner Douglas. We extend our deepest condolences to Arthur's loving wife Sherie, sons Doug and David, daughter Dan...
docs.lead_paragraph: SILVERMAN--Arthur. The employees of Senator Investment Group mourn the passing of Arthur Silverman, beloved father of our managing partner Douglas. We extend our deepest condolences to Arthur's loving wife Sherie, sons Doug and David, daughter Danielle, son-in-law Adam, daughters-in-law Fabienne and Jennifer, and his seven adoring grandchildren. Our thoughts and prayers are with the Silverman family.

docs.snippet: SAYPOL--Ronald Deitz, 85, died in Jackson Hole, WY, after many years conquering the seemingly impossible, he died with love in his heart and a fight in his spirit. He is the son of Irving and Adele Saypol. He is predeceased by his twin brother, Ro...

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SAYPOL, RONALD DEITZ

docs.lead_paragraph: SAYPOL--Ronald Deitz, 85, died in Jackson Hole, WY, after many years conquering the seemingly impossible, he died with love in his heart and a fight in his spirit. He is the son of Irving and Adele Saypol. He is predeceased by his twin brother, Roger. He is survived by his long term partner, Florence, sister, Barbara, daughters, Cathy, Amy, Natasha and son, RD. He graduated from Dickinson College and Brooklyn Law. He was President of the Lionel Corporation. Later in Jackson Hole he became a conservationist/developer. He loved people, the outdoors, dogs and food, not necessarily in that order. A teller of stories and a giver of avuncular advice, Ron always made an entrance and exit with his presence being felt wherever he went. Contributions can be made to Jackson Hole Land Trust or the Center of the Arts. A memorial service will be held on January 7, 2015. For more details please email: rememberronsaypol@ gmail.com Florence Lemle

headline.main: Costa Concordia Capt Defiant on the Stand
headline.print_headline: Costa Concordia Capt Defiant on the Stand

docs.lead_paragraph: Francesco Schettino, accused by survivors, politicians and the media of dereliction of duty after the 2012 shipwreck of the Costa Concordia cruise liner under his command killed 32, testified in his own defense for the first time Tuesday, defiant and gesticulating under questioning from Italian prosecutors.

headline.print_headline: Bill Would Cap Russian Engines on U.S. Satellite Launches
